title: Relates to the shipment of cigarettes

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 12, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. DINOWITZ -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Ways and Means

       AN  ACT  to  amend the public health law, in relation to the shipment of
         cigarettes

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Subdivision 1 of section 1399-ll of the public health law,
    2  as added by chapter 262 of the laws of  2000,  is  amended  to  read  as
    3  follows:
    4    1.  It  shall  be  unlawful  for any person engaged in the business of
    5  selling cigarettes to ship or cause to be shipped any cigarettes to  any
    6  person  in  this  state who is not: (a) a person licensed as a cigarette
    7  tax agent or wholesale dealer under article twenty of  the  tax  law  or
    8  registered  retail dealer under section four hundred eighty-a of the tax
    9  law; (b) an export warehouse proprietor pursuant to chapter  52  of  the
   10  internal  revenue  code  or  an  operator  of a customs bonded warehouse
   11  pursuant to section 1311 or 1555 of title 19 of the United States  Code;
   12  or  (c)  a  person  who  is  an officer, employee or agent of the United
   13  States government, this state or a department,  agency,  instrumentality
   14  or political subdivision of the United States or this state AND PRESENTS
   15  HIMSELF  OR  HERSELF  AS  SUCH, when such person is acting in accordance
   16  with his or her official duties. For purposes  of  this  subdivision,  a
   17  person  is  a  licensed or registered agent or dealer described in para-
   18  graph (a) of this subdivision if his or her name appears on  a  list  of
   19  licensed  or registered agents or dealers published by the department of
   20  taxation and finance, or if such person is licensed or registered as  an
   21  agent or dealer under article twenty of the tax law.
   22    S  2.  Subdivision  2  of section 1399-ll of the public health law, as
   23  added by chapter 262 of the laws of 2000, is amended to read as follows:
   24    2. It shall be unlawful for any common or contract carrier to knowing-
   25  ly transport cigarettes to any person in this state reasonably  believed

    1  by  such  carrier  to be other than a person described in paragraph (a),
    2  (b) or (c) of subdivision one of  this  section.  For  purposes  of  the
    3  preceding  sentence,  if  cigarettes  are transported to a home or resi-
    4  dence,  it  shall  be  presumed that the common or contract carrier knew
    5  that such person was not a person described in paragraph (a), (b) or (c)
    6  of subdivision one of this section. It shall be unlawful for  any  other
    7  person  to  knowingly  transport cigarettes to any person in this state,
    8  other than to a person described in paragraph (a), (b) or (c) of  subdi-
    9  vision  one  of  this  section.  Nothing  in  this  subdivision shall be
   10  construed to prohibit a [person other than a] common or contract carrier
   11  OR A REGISTERED RETAIL DEALER UNDER SECTION FOUR HUNDRED EIGHTY-A OF THE
   12  TAX LAW from transporting not more than eight hundred cigarettes at  any
   13  one time to any person in this state.
   14    S  3.  Subdivision  5  of section 1399-ll of the public health law, as
   15  added by chapter 262 of the laws of 2000, is amended to read as follows:
   16    5. Any person who violates the provisions of subdivision one or two of
   17  this section shall be guilty of a class A misdemeanor and for  a  second
   18  or subsequent violation shall be guilty of a class E felony. In addition
   19  to  the criminal penalty, [the commissioner may impose a civil fine] ANY
   20  PERSON WHO VIOLATES THE PROVISIONS OF SUBDIVISION ONE, TWO OR  THREE  OF
   21  THIS  SECTION  SHALL  BE  SUBJECT  TO  A CIVIL PENALTY not to exceed THE
   22  GREATER OF (A) five thousand dollars for each  such  violation  [on  any
   23  person  who violates subdivision one or two of this section. The commis-
   24  sioner may impose a civil fine not to exceed five thousand  dollars  for
   25  each  violation  of  subdivision  three  of  this  section on any person
   26  engaged in the business of selling cigarettes who ships or causes to  be
   27  shipped  any  such  cigarettes  to any person in this state]; OR (B) ONE
   28  HUNDRED DOLLARS FOR EACH  PACK  OF  CIGARETTES  SHIPPED,  CAUSED  TO  BE
   29  SHIPPED OR TRANSPORTED IN VIOLATION OF SUCH SUBDIVISION.
   30    S 4. Section 1399-ll of the public health law, as added by chapter 262
   31  of the laws of 2000, is amended by adding a new subdivision 6 to read as
   32  follows:
   33    6.  THE  ATTORNEY  GENERAL  MAY  BRING  AN ACTION TO RECOVER THE CIVIL
   34  PENALTIES PROVIDED BY SUBDIVISION FIVE OF  THIS  SECTION  AND  FOR  SUCH
   35  OTHER  RELIEF  AS  MAY BE DEEMED NECESSARY. IN ADDITION, THE CORPORATION
   36  COUNSEL OF ANY POLITICAL SUBDIVISION THAT IMPOSES A  TAX  ON  CIGARETTES
   37  MAY  BRING AN ACTION TO RECOVER THE CIVIL PENALTIES PROVIDED BY SUBDIVI-
   38  SION FIVE OF THIS SECTION AND FOR SUCH OTHER RELIEF  AS  MAY  BE  DEEMED
   39  NECESSARY  WITH  RESPECT TO ANY CIGARETTES SHIPPED, CAUSED TO BE SHIPPED
   40  OR TRANSPORTED IN VIOLATION OF THIS SECTION TO ANY PERSON LOCATED WITHIN
   41  SUCH POLITICAL SUBDIVISION. ALL CIVIL PENALTIES  OBTAINED  IN  ANY  SUCH
   42  ACTION  SHALL BE RETAINED BY THE STATE OR POLITICAL SUBDIVISION BRINGING
   43  SUCH ACTION, PROVIDED THAT NO PERSON SHALL  BE  REQUIRED  TO  PAY  CIVIL
   44  PENALTIES  TO BOTH THE STATE AND A POLITICAL SUBDIVISION WITH RESPECT TO
   45  THE SAME VIOLATION OF THIS SECTION.
   46    S 5. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to the shipment of cigarettes
